analyzed: go cha bsngags pa phyogs bcur bzlog mi nus // kun dga' bzang skyong rin chen 'byung gnas dang // dkon mchog 'byung gnas dang ni ded dpon bzang //
translated: The praise of their armor cannot be stopped in the ten directions.🔽Ānanda, Bhadrapāla, Ratnākara,🔽Ratnākara, and the good captain,

original: yon tan sbas pa mkhas dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: yon tan sbas pa mkhas dang de bzhin du //
translated: Guṇagupta, the wise one, and likewise🔽the hero Bhadrasena, look at them!🔽The one called Jala, and the water god,

original: dpa' bo bzang stobs gang yin de la ltos; ;chu zhes bya ba dang ni chu lha dang // bzang skyong de bzhin dge slong ci 'dra rnams //
analyzed: dpa' bo bzang stobs gang yin de la ltos; ;chu zhes bya ba dang ni chu lha dang // bzang skyong de bzhin dge slong ci 'dra rnams //
translated: Bhadrapāla, and the monks like that,

original: ji ltar skyob 'gyur dge slong de dag ltos //
analyzed: ji ltar skyob 'gyur dge slong de dag ltos //
translated: look at those monks who will be protectors!

original: de dag rnams kyi go cha de bsam yas //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi go cha de bsam yas //
translated: Their armor is inconceivable.

original: don yod ces ni yongs su bsgrags gyur pa //
analyzed: don yod ces ni yongs su bsgrags gyur pa //
translated: The one who is proclaimed as Amogha,

original: de dag gis ni don yod go cha bgos //
analyzed: de dag gis ni don yod go cha bgos //
translated: he has put on the armor of Amogha.

original: de dag mthong ba'ang don yod 'gyur yin na //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba'ang don yod 'gyur yin na //
translated: Even seeing them is meaningful,

original: de dag bsnyen bkur byed pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: de dag bsnyen bkur byed pa smos ci dgos //
translated: how much more so for those who serve them!

original: kun dga' gang su dag gis de dag mthong //
analyzed: kun dga' gang su dag gis de dag mthong //
translated: Ānanda, whoever sees them,

original: gang dag su yis ming yang thos gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dag su yis ming yang thos gyur pa //
translated: and whoever hears their names,

original: de dag nam yang byang chub dogs pa med //
analyzed: de dag nam yang byang chub dogs pa med //
translated: they will never doubt enlightenment.

original: de dag nam du'ang log par ltung mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag nam du'ang log par ltung mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never fall into the lower realms.

original: de dag thams cad brtson pas tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brtson pas tshogs pa yin //
translated: They will all be diligent and will gather the accumulations.

original: de dag thams cad shes pas tshogs par gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad shes pas tshogs par gyur //
translated: They will all be wise and will gather the accumulations.

original: rtag tu tshul khrims phung pos de rtag gnas //
analyzed: rtag tu tshul khrims phung pos de rtag gnas //
translated: They will always abide in the aggregate of discipline.

original: thams cad theg pa mchog la de ltar 'dud //
analyzed: thams cad theg pa mchog la de ltar 'dud //
translated: They will all be devoted to the supreme vehicle.

original: kun dga' sangs rgyas zhing 'dir phyogs bcu yi //
analyzed: kun dga' sangs rgyas zhing 'dir phyogs bcu yi //
translated: Ānanda, in this buddha realm, in the ten directions,

original: 'jig rten da ltar gang dag su gnas pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten da ltar gang dag su gnas pa //
translated: All those who are present in the world now,

original: dpa' bo de yi go cha 'dod gyur pa //
analyzed: dpa' bo de yi go cha 'dod gyur pa //
translated: The heroes who desire that armor

original: de la rgyal ba kun gyis @144a *//🔽bsngags pa brjod //
analyzed: de la rgyal ba kun gyis @144a *// bsngags pa brjod //
translated: Are praised by all the victors.

original: gang gis bsngags brjod rgyal ba de dag kyang //
analyzed: gang gis bsngags brjod rgyal ba de dag kyang //
translated: Those who are praised by the victors

original: byang chub sems dpas de tshe der shes te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de tshe der shes te //
translated: The bodhisattvas will know at that time.🔽They will see the supreme Shakyas, the protectors of the world,

original: sh'akya khyu mchog 'jig rten mgon po dang // byang chub zhugs pa'i dpa' bo dag blta 'o //
analyzed: sh'akya khyu mchog 'jig rten mgon po dang // byang chub zhugs pa'i dpa' bo dag blta 'o //
translated: And the heroes who have set out for enlightenment.

original: de thos nas kyang gsol ba btab gyur pa //
analyzed: de thos nas kyang gsol ba btab gyur pa //
translated: Having heard that, they will make requests:

original: mgon po mi mjed 'jig rten khams su mchi //
analyzed: mgon po mi mjed 'jig rten khams su mchi //
translated: “May the protector go to the world system of Patient Endurance!

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku la bskor byas nas //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku la bskor byas nas //
translated: Having circumambulated the bodies of the victors,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad lhags //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad lhags //
translated: And all those bodhisattvas have come here.

original: dge slong de dag gi yang ming thos nas //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gi yang ming thos nas //
translated: Having heard the names of those bhikṣus,

original: de tshe byang chub mchog tu 'dun pa bskyed //
analyzed: de tshe byang chub mchog tu 'dun pa bskyed //
translated: At that time they developed the aspiration for supreme enlightenment.

original: gang dag ming dang 'dun pas byang chub zhugs //
analyzed: gang dag ming dang 'dun pas byang chub zhugs //
translated: Those who aspired to enlightenment through their names and aspirations,

original: de dag rgyal bas byang chub der lung bstan //🔽bskal ba grangs med dag tu las byas shing //
analyzed: de dag rgyal bas byang chub der lung bstan // bskal ba grangs med dag tu las byas shing //
translated: The Jina prophesied their enlightenment.🔽Those who have practiced for countless eons,

original: mi dge bsgrubs pa gang dag su yod pa //
analyzed: mi dge bsgrubs pa gang dag su yod pa //
translated: And have accomplished what is nonvirtuous,

original: de phyir snyigs ma'i dus na de dag ni //
analyzed: de phyir snyigs ma'i dus na de dag ni //
translated: Therefore, in this degenerate age, they

original: nga dang lhan cig sangs rgyas zhing du lhags //
analyzed: nga dang lhan cig sangs rgyas zhing du lhags //
translated: Came to my buddha realm with me.

original: nga yis byang chub mchog 'di thob gyur kyang //
analyzed: nga yis byang chub mchog 'di thob gyur kyang //
translated: Although I attained this supreme enlightenment,

original: de tshe sems can blta bar spro ba med //
analyzed: de tshe sems can blta bar spro ba med //
translated: At that time I had no interest in seeing beings.

original: gang dag phyi dus dge slong rnams 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang dag phyi dus dge slong rnams 'byung ba //
translated: Those who will be bhikṣus in the future

original: rtsub dang gtum dang shin tu rtsub pa yin //
analyzed: rtsub dang gtum dang shin tu rtsub pa yin //
translated: Will be harsh, violent, and extremely harsh.

original: de tshe kun tu 'jigs pa thos nas su //
analyzed: de tshe kun tu 'jigs pa thos nas su //
translated: At that time, having heard of the terrors,

original: yang dang yang du brtson 'grus stobs bskyed cing //
analyzed: yang dang yang du brtson 'grus stobs bskyed cing //
translated: They will again and again generate the power of diligence.

original: mu ge'i dus su zan rjen sbyin pa byin //
analyzed: mu ge'i dus su zan rjen sbyin pa byin //
translated: “In times of famine, they give away food,

original: de dag rnams kyi sbyin pa rtsub pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi sbyin pa rtsub pa yin //
translated: And their generosity is harsh.

original: de dag 'di la gus pa che byas nas //
analyzed: de dag 'di la gus pa che byas nas //
translated: “They will have great respect for this,🔽And in the future, during that time of great terror,

original: phyi dus 'jigs pa chen po de yi @144b tshe; ;srog kyang btang nas don ni bya snyam ste //
analyzed: phyi dus 'jigs pa chen po de yi @144b tshe; ;srog kyang btang nas don ni bya snyam ste //
translated: They will think, ‘I will give up my life to help others,’

original: nga yi chos mchog spel zhing 'dzin par byed //🔽dus de na ni mi dge'i las rnams kyi //
analyzed: nga yi chos mchog spel zhing 'dzin par byed // dus de na ni mi dge'i las rnams kyi //
translated: And they will spread and uphold my supreme Dharma.🔽“At that time, in the world,

original: smon lam gnas kyang 'jig rten dag na yod //
analyzed: smon lam gnas kyang 'jig rten dag na yod //
translated: There will be those who make aspirations for nonvirtue.

original: 'di na las de dag ni byas pa na //
analyzed: 'di na las de dag ni byas pa na //
translated: When they have performed those actions,

original: de yi tshe na brnyas pa'i tshul du 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi tshe na brnyas pa'i tshul du 'gyur //
translated: They will be treated with contempt.

original: de dag der ni 'di 'dra'i chos thos nas //
analyzed: de dag der ni 'di 'dra'i chos thos nas //
translated: “When they hear such Dharma as this,

original: de tshe der ni chos min 'du shes 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe der ni chos min 'du shes 'gyur //
translated: They will think that it is not Dharma.

original: chos 'di rgyal bas gsungs pa ma yin zhes //
analyzed: chos 'di rgyal bas gsungs pa ma yin zhes //
translated: ‘This Dharma was not taught by the Victorious One.’

original: 'jig rten phyin ci log la kun dga' ltos //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyin ci log la kun dga' ltos //
translated: See how the world delights in error!

original: de tshe dge slong slob pas 'du byed la //
analyzed: de tshe dge slong slob pas 'du byed la //
translated: “At that time, monks who are training will become discouraged

original: rtag pa cung zad med ces skyo thob pas //
analyzed: rtag pa cung zad med ces skyo thob pas //
translated: When they hear, ‘There is not the slightest permanence in conditioned things.’

original: de tshe mgo la me 'bar bzhin du rtogs //
analyzed: de tshe mgo la me 'bar bzhin du rtogs //
translated: At that time, they will understand as if a fire were burning their heads.

original: 'chi med thob par bya phyir ma lus brtsal //
analyzed: 'chi med thob par bya phyir ma lus brtsal //
translated: And to attain immortality, they will strive with all their strength.

original: bstan 'di rab tu rnam par 'jig thos nas //
analyzed: bstan 'di rab tu rnam par 'jig thos nas //
translated: “When they hear that this teaching is completely destroyed,

original: der ni lha yang sdug bsngal dag tu gyur //
analyzed: der ni lha yang sdug bsngal dag tu gyur //
translated: The gods will be overcome with suffering.

original: de tshe 'jigs pa mthong na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: de tshe 'jigs pa mthong na mi rung zhes //
translated: ‘It is not right to see such a terrifying time as this!’

original: de lta'i dus su shi yang bla snyam sems //
analyzed: de lta'i dus su shi yang bla snyam sems //
translated: ‘It is better to die at such a time!’

original: bag tsha med pa'i sgrog pa sgrog pa yi //
analyzed: bag tsha med pa'i sgrog pa sgrog pa yi //
translated: “The great sages, who speak without hesitation,

original: drang srong che de de ring bdag cag mthong //
analyzed: drang srong che de de ring bdag cag mthong //
translated: Will see us today.

original: 'dren pa mchog gi zhal du lha byed cing //
analyzed: 'dren pa mchog gi zhal du lha byed cing //
translated: They will say to the face of the supreme guide,

original: kye ma rgyal bas bshad ces yi rang ngo //
analyzed: kye ma rgyal bas bshad ces yi rang ngo //
translated: ‘Alas, we rejoice in what the Victorious One has taught!’

original: dge slong bsam gtan byed pa dag kyang mthong //
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan byed pa dag kyang mthong //
translated: “They will see monks who practice meditation,

original: dbang thob rdzu 'phrul stobs kyis mkhas gyur pa //🔽'di na ting 'dzin shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: dbang thob rdzu 'phrul stobs kyis mkhas gyur pa // 'di na ting 'dzin shes rab pha rol phyin //
translated: Who have attained the powers and are skilled through the power of miracles.🔽They will see those who have perfected samādhi and insight

original: de dag phyi ma'i dus su ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de dag phyi ma'i dus su ji ltar mthong //
translated: In the future.

original: sdig pa'i dge slong stobs dang ldan 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dge slong stobs dang ldan 'gyur zhing //
translated: “Evil monks will become powerful

original: de'i tshe tshul ldan shin tu tshar bcad 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshul ldan shin tu tshar bcad 'gyur //
translated: And at that time, those who are ethical will be completely destroyed.

original: gnas @145a *// khang gnas pa tshegs kyis 'thob 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gnas @145a *// khang gnas pa tshegs kyis 'thob 'gyur zhing //
translated: “They will obtain their dwelling place through hardship,

original: de tshe lha yid shin tu mi dga' 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe lha yid shin tu mi dga' 'gyur //
translated: and at that time the gods will be very unhappy.

original: kye ma kye ma bstan pa rab tu 'jig /
analyzed: kye ma kye ma bstan pa rab tu 'jig /
translated: Alas, alas! The teaching is being destroyed!🔽“Those who practice austerities at that time

original: gang gi don du de tshe dka' spyod pa; ;de dag dge slong sdig pas tshar bcad 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi don du de tshe dka' spyod pa; ;de dag dge slong sdig pas tshar bcad 'gyur //
translated: will be destroyed by the evil monks.

original: bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba 'di la ltos //
analyzed: bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba 'di la ltos //
translated: Look at the destruction of the teaching!

original: 'dir ni phan tshun kun tu dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir ni phan tshun kun tu dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: “Here they will all be mutually agreeable,

original: nges pa rnams la de dag bsngags min brjod //
analyzed: nges pa rnams la de dag bsngags min brjod //
translated: and they will speak uncomplimentarily of the steadfast ones.

original: sangs rgyas la ni 'khrug long byed pa dag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni 'khrug long byed pa dag /
translated: Those who are quarrelsome with the Buddha

original: de dag khyim na gnas par 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag khyim na gnas par 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: “They will be taken as householders,

original: dge bsnyen ma dang 'dre bar byed 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma dang 'dre bar byed 'gyur zhing //
translated: and they will associate with laywomen,

original: de na de dag lag pa gcig tu byed //
analyzed: de na de dag lag pa gcig tu byed //
translated: and they will be in cahoots with them.

original: rgyal ba'i bstan la ma gus gyur nas su //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bstan la ma gus gyur nas su //
translated: “Having no respect for the teachings of the Jina,

original: byang chub mchog kyang spong bar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub mchog kyang spong bar byed par 'gyur //
translated: they will abandon supreme awakening.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchog tu 'tshe 'gyur te //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchog tu 'tshe 'gyur te //
translated: They will be the worst enemies of the Three Jewels,

original: de dag rtag tu nges pa rnams kyis spongs //
analyzed: de dag rtag tu nges pa rnams kyis spongs //
translated: and they will always be rejected by the steadfast ones.

original: khyu mchog rva chag ma gyur ma rungs pa //🔽de bzhin tshul khrims ldan pas rnam par spongs //
analyzed: khyu mchog rva chag ma gyur ma rungs pa // de bzhin tshul khrims ldan pas rnam par spongs //
translated: Like a bull with a broken horn,🔽the one with moral discipline will be rejected.

original: de tshe tshul khrims ldan pa dpyas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de tshe tshul khrims ldan pa dpyas 'gyur zhing //
translated: “At that time, the one with moral discipline will be blamed,

original: de tshe dge slong sdig pas brnyes tshul 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe dge slong sdig pas brnyes tshul 'gyur //
translated: and at that time, the monk will be ruined by evil.

original: 'jigs chen phyin ci log gi dus su ni //
analyzed: 'jigs chen phyin ci log gi dus su ni //
translated: “In this time of great fear and delusion,

original: skyo ba thob byos bag kyang yod par gyis //
analyzed: skyo ba thob byos bag kyang yod par gyis //
translated: you should be saddened and careful.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan la brtson 'grus skyed //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan la brtson 'grus skyed //
translated: You should generate diligence in the teachings of the Sugata,

original: de tshe 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: for at that time, great fear will arise.

original: sdig pa'i dge slong rnams dang phrad ma byed //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dge slong rnams dang phrad ma byed //
translated: “Do not associate with evil monks,

original: de yi tshe na sdug bsngal @145b gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi tshe na sdug bsngal @145b gnas par 'gyur //
translated: for at that time, you will be a vessel of suffering.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bltas pa'i byang chub tu nges pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snying stobs kyi go cha bgos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bltas pa'i byang chub tu nges pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snying stobs kyi go cha bgos 'di lta ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samanta­vyavalokita­bodhisattva­niyāma­pratilabdha­kuśalamūla­sāra­saṃnāha,🔽just as a strong man would extend his flexed arm

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
translated: or flex his extended arm,

original: brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig des de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
analyzed: brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig des de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
translated: In the time it takes a strong man to stretch out and withdraw his arm, he disappeared from the buddhafield of the Tathāgata Jñānottama and arrived in the world of Enduring.

original: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the place where the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, was residing and, having approached him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: he touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: the Tathāgata Sarva­māra­sarva­jñāna­darśana­rāja asks whether the Blessed One has encountered but little hardship or discomfort,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: whether he is well and strong,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa bdud thams cad la sku kun tu ston pa'i khyu mchog snyun gsol lags so //
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa bdud thams cad la sku kun tu ston pa'i khyu mchog snyun gsol lags so //
translated: and whether he remains in good health.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
translated: does that Blessed One have few troubles,

original: stobs dang ldan nam /🔽'gyur ba mi mnga'am /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan nam / 'gyur ba mi mnga'am /
translated: is he strong,🔽and is he well?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags so //
analyzed: de lta lags so //
translated: it is so.”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan ldan zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan ldan zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: “Beyond that universe there is a universe known as Saṃpannā.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan med nga ro zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang @146a *//
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan med nga ro zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang @146a *//
translated: In that universe dwells the thus-gone Anirghosa. Abiding and remaining present there, he teaches the Dharma.

original: ston te / bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab tshangs dbyangs nga ro zhes bya ba btang ngo //
analyzed: ston te / bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab tshangs dbyangs nga ro zhes bya ba btang ngo //
translated: This blessed one has dispatched his regent, the bodhisattva Melodious Call of Brahmā.

original: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams 'dzin med ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams 'dzin med ces bya ba yod de /
translated: “Beyond that universe there is a universe known as Asthānam.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma med pa'i nga ro zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma med pa'i nga ro zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In that universe dwells the thus-gone Anirghosa. Abiding and remaining present there, he teaches the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mtshan nyid gcig pas mchod ces bya ba btang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mtshan nyid gcig pas mchod ces bya ba btang ngo //
translated: This blessed one has dispatched his regent, the bodhisattva Worship of the Single Characteristic.

original: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan nyid med pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba yod de; de na de bzhin gshegs pa padma'i mchog ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan nyid med pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba yod de; de na de bzhin gshegs pa padma'i mchog ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: Situated beyond that universe was a universe known as Seal Without Characteristics, and within that universe resided a thus-gone one known as Supreme Lotus. Abiding and remaining present there, he taught the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab padma rab tu gtor ba'i char pa zhes bya ba btang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab padma rab tu gtor ba'i char pa zhes bya ba btang ngo //
translated: This blessed one now dispatched his regent, the bodhisattva Lotus Rain of Scattered Flowers.

original: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams zla ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams zla ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Situated beyond that universe was a universe known as Moon Banner,

translated: Bodhisattvas like these, countless and limitless, who were impeded by only one birth, went to the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana by Rājagṛha, to where the Bhagavat was, and having arrived, they bowed down at the Bhagavat’s feet,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig la phyag 'tshal zhing phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

original: rigs kyi bu /

translated: Having arrived,🔽he bowed his head to the Bhagavān’s feet and sat down to one side.🔽From the buddha realm of the bhagavān tathāgata Vimalap

original: de'i tshe byang phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams rgyu skar gyi phreng ba zhes bya @158b ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams rgyu skar gyi phreng ba zhes bya @158b ba yod de /
translated: At that time, in the northern direction, past innumerable, uncountable world systems, there was a world system called Constellation Garland.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In it resided the Tathagata called Proclamation of the Unfailing Name. Abiding and remaining steadfast, he taught the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go cha zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go cha zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: This Blessed One had prophesied that a Bodhisattva called Armor of Certainty in Turning the Irreversible Wheel would awaken to unsurpassable, perfect and complete buddhahood.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog de la des 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog de la des 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, this Bodhisattva saw that great light and heard that sound of the clear voice. He went to the Blessed One, the Tathagata Proclamation of the Unfailing Name, and asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: 'od kun tu gda' ba dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go cha la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rigs kyi bu /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas lho phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /🔽de na de bzhin gshegs ba sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od kun tu gda' ba dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go cha la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rigs kyi bu / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas lho phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de / de na de bzhin gshegs ba sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la 'di lta ste /
translated: Whose are these lights and the sounds of clear speech?”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ste snod ces bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi chos kyang ston te /🔽snang ba de dang / gsung @159a *//🔽bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ste snod ces bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi chos kyang ston te /🔽snang ba de dang / gsung @159a *//🔽bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de ni /

original: de'i yin no //
analyzed: de'i yin no //
translated: It is so.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der ni /
translated: In that buddha-field,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha ba gos pa dag skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha ba gos pa dag skyes te /
translated: there are bodhisattvas who have put on the inconceivable armor,

original: de dag gi ming brjod pa tsam gyis phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ming brjod pa tsam gyis phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: and by merely uttering their names, the bodhisattvas of the ten directions will be destined for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog la byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go chas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog la byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar nges pa'i go chas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Definite Armor of the Irreversible Wheel who had just generated the mind of awakening to the Tathāgata Amoghadhvaja said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will go to that buddha-field of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni.

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Go, son of good family.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has come, then go.

original: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: With my words, ask him if he has encountered but little hardship,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: if he has encountered but little trouble,🔽if he is well,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
translated: and if he is abiding in happiness and strength.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te bskor ba'ang byas nas song ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te bskor ba'ang byas nas song ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva bowed to the feet of that blessed one, circumambulated him, and departed.

original: de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed @159b pa'am; brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig dang / thang gcig dang / yud tsam des 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed @159b pa'am; brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig dang / thang gcig dang / yud tsam des 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
translated: In an instant, a moment, or a second, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, he disappeared from that world system and arrived in the world system called Endurance.

original: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He went to the place where the Bhagavat, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni was, and having arrived there, he bowed his head at the Bhagavat’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, he said this to the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam; bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam; bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: “Bhagavat,🔽the Tathāgata Amoghadarśin inquires whether you have encountered but little hardship, but little misfortune, whether you are strong,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog snyun gsol lags so //
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog snyun gsol lags so //
translated: and whether you are living at ease.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
translated: does that Bhagavat have but little hardship,

original: stobs dang ldan nam /🔽bde ba dang ldan nam /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan nam / bde ba dang ldan nam /
translated: is he strong,🔽is he happy,

original: 'gyur ba mi mnga'am /
analyzed: 'gyur ba mi mnga'am /
translated: and is he free from anger?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de lta lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de lta lags so //
translated: He replied, “Bhagavat, it is so.”

original: de'i tshe byang phyogs nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa don yod ming sgrog la sogs te bcom ldan 'das don yod rnam par gnon gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du don yod khyu mchog dang / don yod 'od zar dang /🔽brtson 'grus mtha' yas dang / s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po dang / brtson @160a *//

original: gzhan dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags te /
translated: and who, having approached the Lord,

original: lhags nas kyang bcom @160b ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: lhags nas kyang bcom @160b ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: had bowed their heads at his feet and were sitting there in the assembly.

original: de'i tshe 'og gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dag ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'og gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dag ces bya ba yod de /
translated: At that time, in the lower direction, past as many worlds as there are sands in the Ganges River, there was a world called Sphere of the Pure Sky.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In it the Tathagata called Great Eye was dwelling, living, existing, manifesting, teaching the Dharma, and converting people.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bu zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bu zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: The Lord had predicted that a Bodhisattva called Son of the Stage would attain the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bus snang ba chen po de mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bus snang ba chen po de mthong ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Anupamatejā saw that great light

original: gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos so //
analyzed: gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos so //
translated: and heard that sound of the proclamation.

original: thos nas kyang bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: thos nas kyang bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having heard it, he said to that bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: 'od kyi snang ba kun tu gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
analyzed: 'od kyi snang ba kun tu gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
translated: whose is this appearance of light and this sound of the proclamation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: That bhagavān said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: steng gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
translated: above, past innumerable, unfathomable world systems, there is a world system called Enduring.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In it dwells the tathāgata called Śākyamuni. He lives there, lives on, and teaches the Dharma.

original: mthu de ni /
analyzed: mthu de ni /
translated: That power

original: de'i yin no //
analyzed: de'i yin no //
translated: is his.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni /🔽da ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim @161a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni / da ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim @161a *//
translated: That tathāgata

original: par byed pa /
analyzed: par byed pa /
translated: now teaches the bodhisattva canon that completely satisfies all beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma discourse called “The Resolution of All Doubts of All Sentient Beings.”

original: mthu de lta bu de ni /🔽de'i yin no //
analyzed: mthu de lta bu de ni / de'i yin no //
translated: Such is his power.

original: 'khor de na'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa dpe med pa sems pa dag chos bstan pa de nyan par byed de /
analyzed: 'khor de na'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa dpe med pa sems pa dag chos bstan pa de nyan par byed de /
translated: In that assembly, the bodhisattva mahāsattva great armor-wearers, who are beyond compare and are wise, listen to that Dharma teaching.

original: de dag gi ming brjod pa tsam gyis sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ming brjod pa tsam gyis sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely uttering their names, sentient beings will be destined for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rim pa'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rim pa'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva son of Dṛḍha spoke to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la blta pa dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la blta pa dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
translated: “Bhagavān, I will go to that Sahā world realm in order to see, pay homage to, and honor the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni.”

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: The bhagavān said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has come, then go.

original: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /
analyzed: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: With my words, ask about his minor troubles,

original: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: his minor difficulties,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: whether he is well,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
translated: and whether he is abiding in health and well-being.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rim pa'i bu bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rim pa'i bu bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Pūrṇa bowed down at the feet of that bhagavān,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / skyes bu stobs @161b dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / skyes bu stobs @161b dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
translated: and in that very instant,

original: brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig des 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas de 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
analyzed: brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig des 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas de 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
translated: like a strong man stretching out his bent arm or bending his outstretched arm, he disappeared from that world system and arrived in the world system called Endurance.

original: de rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇu­vana by Rājagṛha, to where the bhagavān was.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He addressed the Lord with these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: the Tathāgata Mahāloka asks the Bhagavān if he has encountered but little hardship or discomfort,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: if he is well,🔽if he is strong,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po snyun gsol lags so //
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po snyun gsol lags so //
translated: and if he is living in touch with the supreme happiness.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rigs kyi bu /🔽ci sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na bcom ldan 'das de gnod pa chung ngam /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rim pa'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rigs kyi bu / ci sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na bcom ldan 'das de gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Bhadrapāla, “Noble son,

original: snyun mi mnga'am /
analyzed: snyun mi mnga'am /
translated: in that buddha realm, is the Bhagavān encountering but little hardship or discomfort?🔽Is he well?

original: bde bar gnas sam /
analyzed: bde bar gnas sam /
translated: Is he strong?🔽Is he living in touch with the supreme happiness?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de lta lags so //
analyzed: de lta lags so //
translated: it is so.

original: de ltar da bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po la sogs te /
analyzed: de ltar da bzhin gshegs pa spyan chen po la sogs te /
translated: In that way the Tathāgata Mahāloka

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mchog gi dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa padma'i dpal 'byung dang / sangge'i dpal dang / don grub dang / dpal sbas dang / sengge'i gram pa dang / shin tu rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mchog gi dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa padma'i dpal 'byung dang / sangge'i dpal dang / don grub dang / dpal sbas dang / sengge'i gram pa dang / shin tu rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po dang /
translated: Buddhaprabha, Siddhārtha, Śrīgupta, Siṃhapuṣkarasārin, Supratiṣṭhita-rāja,

original: tshangs @162a *// pa lhun po dang / spyan rnam par dag pa dang / don yod pa'i gom pas rnam par gnon dang / spos kyi glang bo che dang / spos kyi dpal dang / spos kyi lhun po dang / spyan tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs @162a *// pa lhun po dang / spyan rnam par dag pa dang / don yod pa'i gom pas rnam par gnon dang / spos kyi glang bo che dang / spos kyi dpal dang / spos kyi lhun po dang / spyan tshad med pa dang /
translated: Brahmameru, Viśuddhalocana, Amoghapāda-praharaṇa, Gandhahastī, Gandhaprabha, Gandhamādana, Anantamukha,

original: spos brtsegs dang / rin chen lhun po dang / shin tu rab gnas dang / shin tu rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po dang / s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'dzin dang / me sgron dang / skar mda' sgron ma dang /
analyzed: spos brtsegs dang / rin chen lhun po dang / shin tu rab gnas dang / shin tu rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po dang / s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'dzin dang / me sgron dang / skar mda' sgron ma dang /
translated: Gandhottama, Ratnamegha, Supratiṣṭhita, Supratiṣṭhita-rāja, Sālendrarāja, Tejorāśi, Dhūpa-arka, Uluka,

original: brtson 'grus don yod dang / shin tu yang dag brtags pa'i go cha dang / sengge dang / sems can gyi kha lo sgyur ba dang / rab mchog rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la sogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa grangs med dpag tu med🔽pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus don yod dang / shin tu yang dag brtags pa'i go cha dang / sengge dang / sems can gyi kha lo sgyur ba dang / rab mchog rab tu gnas pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la sogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
translated: and Dṛḍhabala, and Dṛḍhaśūra, and Dṛḍhadatta, and Dṛḍhaparākramasvara, and Dṛḍhaparākrama, and Dṛḍhapratijña, and Dṛḍhavirya, and Amoghavikrama, and Supariśuddhaparikṣāsaṃnāha, and Siṃha, and Sattva­vaineya­vaśaṃvartin, and Prabhūtaratnapraviṣṭarāja, and so on, innumerable, countless bodhisattva mahāsattvas who were impeded by only one birth, from innumerable, countless buddha realms, arrived in this Sahā world realm and in the presence of the Bhagavān.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //🔽bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //🔽bam po dgu pa /
translated: and Sthitamati, and Sūryaprabha, and Candraprabha, and Sūryacandraprabha, and Sūryaprabhāsa, and Candraprabhāsa, and Sūryacandraprabhāsa, and Sūryacandrasumeru, and Sūryacandrasumerupradīparāja, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhin, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabha, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsa, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrī, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmati, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabha, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsa, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrī, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmati, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabha, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsa, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrī, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmati, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabha, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsa, and Sūryacandrasumeruśikhinprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrīmatiprabhāsaśrī, and Sū

original: de'i tshe steng gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams tsandan spos kyi @162b 'od ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe steng gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams tsandan spos kyi @162b 'od ces bya ba yod de /
translated: At that time, in the direction above, past innumerable and unfathomable universes, there was a universe called Sandalwood Fragrance Light.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon par 'phags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs ta 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon par 'phags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs ta 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In that universe lived a thus-gone one called King of Infinitely Sublime Domains. Abiding and remaining present there, he taught the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab nga ro dpag tu med ces bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab nga ro dpag tu med ces bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: This blessed one had a regent bodhisattva named Boundless Melody, to whom he had given the prophecy of his unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nga ro dpag tu med kyis snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos nas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nga ro dpag tu med kyis snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos nas /
translated: When the bodhisattva Boundless Melody saw the great light and heard the sound of the clear voice,

original: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po ga la ba der song ste /
translated: he went to the blessed one, the thus-gone King of Infinitely Sublime Domains.

original: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te gsol pa /
analyzed: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te gsol pa /
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head to the feet of that Bhagavat and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavat,

original: 'od gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
analyzed: 'od gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
translated: whose is this radiance and whose is this clear voice that is heard?”

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: That Bhagavat said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: 'og gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
translated: below, past innumerable, unfathomable world systems, there is a world system called Endurance.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: There dwells the Tathagata Shakyamuni, who lives, is present, and teaches the Dharma.

original: 'khor der yang chos mnyan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpe med pa sems pa dag 'dus par gyur te 'khod do //
analyzed: 'khor der yang chos mnyan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpe med pa sems pa dag 'dus par gyur te 'khod do //
translated: In that assembly, an immeasurable number of bodhisattva mahasattvas have gathered and are seated in order to listen to the Dharma.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said: “Bhagavat,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @163a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @163a *//
translated: Bhagavat Tathagata Shakyamuni,

original: pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de'i thad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de'i thad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o // bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: I will go to the Sahā world to the presence of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The bhagavān said, “Noble son,

original: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has come, then go.

original: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /
analyzed: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: In my name you should ask him whether he has encountered but little hardship,

original: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: but little discomfort,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: whether he is well,

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
translated: and whether he is strong and healthy.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nga ro dag tu med pa bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das de la bskor ba byas nas song ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nga ro dag tu med pa bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das de la bskor ba byas nas song ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Anāvila bowed his head to the feet of that bhagavān, circumambulated that bhagavān three times, and departed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:🔽just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag pa bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
translated: or flex his extended arm,

original: brkyang bskum par byed pa'i skad cig des sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
analyzed: brkyang bskum par byed pa'i skad cig des sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'dug ste /
translated: In that instant, he disappeared from that buddha realm and arrived in the Sahā world system.

original: de rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana by Rājagṛha, to where the Blessed One was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He bowed his head to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Sitting to one side, he said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽the thus-gone Superior King of Infinite Regions inquires whether you have encountered but little hardship or discomfort,

original: bskyod ba yang @163b ngam; stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po snyun gsol lags so //
analyzed: bskyod ba yang @163b ngam; stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po snyun gsol lags so //
translated: and whether you remain healthy, strong, and at ease.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga'am /
translated: “Is the Lord well?🔽Is he strong?

original: stobs dang ldan nam /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan nam /
translated: Is he at ease?

original: 'gyur ba mi mnga'am /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'gyur ba mi mnga'am / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Are you not changing?”🔽He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de lta lags so //
analyzed: de lta lags so //
translated: “Lord, it is so.🔽”

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal bo'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yid gnyis yang dag 'joms dang /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yul mtha' yas par mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus mngon du 'phags pa'i rgyal bo'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yid gnyis yang dag 'joms dang /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata Ananta­viṣaya­abhyudgata­rāja and the other tathāgatas, such as the Tathāgata Vīryābhyudgata­rāja, in the buddhafield of the Lord Tathāgata Vīryābhyudgata­rāja, and in the same way, the Tathāgata Saṃdeśa­saṃghāta,

original: rgyu skar bzang po'i rgyal po dang / nyin mdzad dang / 'od mdzad dang / lhun po 'od dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rnam par dag pa'i 'od dang / zas kyi gdugs dang / spos kyi gdugs dang / rin chen gdugs dang /
analyzed: rgyu skar bzang po'i rgyal po dang / nyin mdzad dang / 'od mdzad dang / lhun po 'od dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rnam par dag pa'i 'od dang / zas kyi gdugs dang / spos kyi gdugs dang / rin chen gdugs dang /
translated: the Tathāgata Śubhanakṣatra­rāja, the Tathāgata Divākara, the Tathāgata Arciṣmān, the Tathāgata Meru­pradīpa, the Tathāgata Jyotirmaṇḍala, the Tathāgata Viśuddha­prabha, the Tathāgata Āhāra­cchattra, the Tathāgata Gandha­cchattra, the Tathāgata Ratna­cchattra,

original: tsandan gyi khang pa dang / dga' ba'i dpal dang / ri rab phung po dang / rin po che'i 'od dang / s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po dang / tshangs pa'i dpal dang / rnam par dag pa'i spyan dang / bag tsha ba mi mnga' ba dang /🔽spu zing zhes byed pa'i 'jigs pa dang / bral ba dang / rin chen go cha mtha' yas dang / bla na med pa'i 'od zer dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dra ba can gyi @164a *//
analyzed: tsandan gyi khang pa dang / dga' ba'i dpal dang / ri rab phung po dang / rin po che'i 'od dang / s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po dang / tshangs pa'i dpal dang / rnam par dag pa'i spyan dang / bag tsha ba mi mnga' ba dang / spu zing zhes byed pa'i 'jigs pa dang / bral ba dang / rin chen go cha mtha' yas dang / bla na med pa'i 'od zer dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dra ba can gyi @164a *//
translated: Candana-gṛha, Nandashri, Meru-skandha, Ratna-prabha, Sāla-rāja, Brahma-shri, Viśuddha-netra, A-śaṅka,🔽A-śaṅka-romāñca-bhaya, Ananta-ratna-varma, Anuttara-raśmi, Tathāgata-jālin-prabha-ketu, Tathāgata-hetu-rāja-buddha-kṣetra, and so forth.

original: 'od kyi tog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la sogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang /
analyzed: 'od kyi tog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la sogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ga la ba dang /
translated: Innumerable and limitless bodhisattva mahāsattvas from the buddha-fields of those countless and limitless blessed buddhas came to this Sahā world system.

original: rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lanta ka gnas pa ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: He then went to the Bamboo Grove in the Kalandaka­nivāpa near Rājagṛha, to the place where the Bhagavat was, and having arrived there, he bowed down at the Bhagavat’s feet and sat down to one side.

original: de'i tshe shar lho'i phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas padma'i me tog 'byung ba'i dpal zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe shar lho'i phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas padma'i me tog 'byung ba'i dpal zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: At that time, in the southeast, past innumerable, countless world systems, there was a world system called Glory of the Appearance of the Buddha’s Lotus Flower.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /
translated: In it resided the Tathāgata called Glory of the Universal Display of the Body of All Buddhas. He lived there, remained there, and taught the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mya ngan bral zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab mya ngan bral zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavat had given the prophecy to the crown prince called Free from Sorrow that he would attain unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan bral gyis snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan bral gyis snang ba chen po de mthong zhing gsung bsal ba'i sgra de'ang thos so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vigatamala saw that great light and heard that sound of the proclamation.

original: thos nas kyang bcom @164b ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal de ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: thos nas kyang bcom @164b ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal de ga la ba der song ste /
translated: Having seen and heard that, he went to the bhagavat, the tathagata Glorious Display of the Body of All Buddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and having bowed his head to the feet of that bhagavat, he said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavat,

original: 'od gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
analyzed: 'od gda' ba de dang / gsung bsal ba'i sgra grags pa de su'i lags /
translated: whose is this radiance and whose is this sound of the proclamation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
translated: That bhagavat replied, “Noble son,

original: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
translated: in the northwest, past countless, limitless world systems, there is a world system called Endurance.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There dwells the Tathagata called Sakyamuni, alive and well, expounding the Doctrine.🔽He is expounding the Doctrine

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpe med pa'i go cha bgos pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpe med pa'i go cha bgos pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: to the Bodhisattva-mahasattvas who are clad in the inconceivable and incomparable armor, expounding to them the Dharma-paryaya called Bodhisattva-pitaka.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la blta ba dang / phyag bgyi pa dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la blta ba dang / phyag bgyi pa dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will go to that Sahaloka world to see, to bow down to, and to honor that Tathagata Sakyamuni.

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: That Bhagavat said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: de'i dus la da bab bar shes na song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab bar shes na song zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has now come, then go.

original: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: nga'i tshig gis gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: With my words, ask him if he has little trouble,🔽if he has little illness,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: if he is strong,

original: @165a *// stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
analyzed: @165a *// stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes snyun yang gsol cig /
translated: and whether he is well and strong.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan bral bcom ldan 'das de la phyag btsal nas song ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan bral bcom ldan 'das de la phyag btsal nas song ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vigataśoka bowed to that blessed one and departed.🔽In an instant,

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag par bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis lag par bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'am /
translated: in the same way that a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm,

analyzed: brkyang ba skum par byed pa'i skad cig des 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /

original: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song nas /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der song nas /
translated: He went to the place where the blessed one, the thus-gone Śākyamuni, was staying.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat to one side, he said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: is the Blessed One well?🔽Are you remaining healthy?

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: Are you strong?

original: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal snyun gsol lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: stobs dang bde bar reg pa la gnas sam zhes de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i dpal snyun gsol lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Are you well and strong?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Noble son,

original: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga' ma /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das de snyun mi mnga' ma /
translated: is that blessed one free from pain?

original: stobs dang ldan nam /🔽'gyur ba mi mnga' ma /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan nam / 'gyur ba mi mnga' ma /
translated: Is he strong?🔽Is he at ease?🔽”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags so //
analyzed: de lta lags so //
translated: it is so.”

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku kun tu ston pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa @165b dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku kun tu ston pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa padma bkod pa'i khyu mchog dang /

translated: In this way, the blessed Thus-Gone One Display of the Bodies of All Buddhas inquired about the illness of the blessed Thus-Gone One Display of the Infinitely Manifested Bodies of the Buddha, and so on.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od dang / 'od mtha' yas sangs rgyas me tog 'byung dang / rin chen s'a la dang / rin chen zla ba'i khyu mchog dang / rtsi'i rgyal po dang / sman dang / ye shes mchog dang / mngon du 'phags pa'i go cha dang /

translated: the Buddha Web of Light, Buddha Infinite Light, Buddha Flower Origin, Buddha Jewel Sala Tree, Buddha Jewel Moon Supreme Bull, Buddha King of Medicines, Buddha Supreme Wisdom, Buddha Manifest Noble Armor,

original: lhun po gong na med pa dang / sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / me tog brtsegs dang / me tog rab gtor dang / rtag tu mdzes pa'i 'od zer dang / bla na med pa'i 'od zer dang / mi g-yos rnam par gnon dang /

translated: Buddha Unsurpassed Mountain, Buddha Turning the Wheel of Dharma as Soon as the Thought of Enlightenment is Generated, Buddha Flower Pile, Buddha Flower Scatterer, Buddha Always Beautiful Light, Buddha Incomparable Light, Buddha Unwavering Subduer,

original: gom pas rnam par gnon dang / gom pa mtha' yas bas rnam par gnon dang / smon lam mtha' yas dang / spobs pa dpag med dang / khyu mchog mtha' yas dang / smon lam ma nges pa dang / mngal 'gyur mdzad dang / skyo med 'gyur mdzad smon lam dang /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab phas ma pham pa zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dbang sbas 'od zer ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab kun nas sbas zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba'i dpal zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab lhun po mchog ces bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams mngon dga' zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma med pa'i nga ro nges pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab spyan ras gzigs kyi nga ro zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab ci 'jigs zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams tshangs ldan zhes bya ba yod de /

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa tshangs pa'i dpal zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te; bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab tshangs pas mchod ces bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab dbang pos byin zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams padma can zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa lhun po'i 'od ces bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab rgya mtsho zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa sgron ma mdzad ces bya ba bzhugs te @172b 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa grags ldan zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab lhun pos byin zhes bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams shin tu rab gnas zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: “Beyond that, there is a world system called Well-Established,

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa bshes gnyen grags po zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te //
translated: The Tathagata Mitrajyotiska resides there, lives there, and teaches the Dharma.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab sengge ltar gnon ces bya ba btang ngo //

analyzed: de'i yang 'dab chags na 'jig rten gyi khams s'a la zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Furthermore, there is a world system called Sāla,

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston te / bcom ldan @173a *//
